intro.title: Gross vs Net Salary: What's the Difference?
intro.description: Understanding the difference between gross and net salary is essential for financial planning. Learn what each term means, how they're calculated, and why it matters for your budget and career decisions.

sections.title: What is Gross Salary?
sections.content: Gross salary, also called gross pay or gross income, is the total amount you earn before any deductions. This includes your base salary plus any bonuses, commissions, or overtime pay.

sections.title: What is Net Salary?
sections.content: Net salary, also called net pay or take-home pay, is the actual amount you receive in your paycheck after all taxes and deductions are subtracted.

sections.title: Common Tax Deductions
sections.content: Several types of taxes and deductions reduce your gross salary to net salary.

taxes.name: Federal Income Tax
taxes.description: Based on your tax bracket (10% to 37%)

faqs.question: How do I calculate net salary from gross?
faqs.answer: Subtract federal income tax, state income tax, and FICA taxes from your gross salary. Use our Gross to Net calculator for accurate calculations.

faqs.question: Are bonuses included in gross salary?
faqs.answer: Yes, bonuses, commissions, and overtime are part of your gross earnings and are subject to the same tax rates as regular salary.

faqs.question: What's the average tax rate in the US?
faqs.answer: The average American pays about 24-28% in total taxes, but this varies significantly based on income, location, and deductions.

faqs.question: Can I reduce my taxable income?
faqs.answer: Yes, through pre-tax deductions like 401(k) contributions, health insurance premiums, and HSA contributions. These reduce your taxable gross income.
